algorithm_technique: Iterate through the array, checking if an element is strictly greater than its neighbors.
problem_summary_simple: Find indices of elements strictly greater than both their neighbors in an array.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate from the second to the second-to-last element, checking `mountain[i-1] < mountain[i] > mountain[i+1]`.
key_insights: Peaks cannot be the first or last element, so the iteration range is `1` to `n-2`.
The condition for a peak at index `i` is `mountain[i-1] < mountain[i]` AND `mountain[i] > mountain[i+1]`.
